data.title: casual dining with semi fast food, tasty!!!!
data.text: Rather like a fast food as you order at the counter, and it is brought to you. Most food is in a paper lined basket but it is very very tasty.  Not expensive, but fair price. Best breakfast tacos in town.

data.title: Pretty good tacos in casual setting
data.text: The tacos are big and tasty, but I don't think this place rates the number 1 restaurant rating in College Station.

data.title: Good for the price
data.text: It is an inexpensive place to have a quick lunch. The wait can be incredible, but you can call in with your order. Their outdoor area could use a little ambience. Nice patio but not many people sit out there. Maybe cleaner tables? A bunch of small tables instead of two really big ones? The food that I have had there mainly consists of chicken and avocado tacos, that those are good with the sauces.

data.title: Worth the wait!
data.text: Wow! My first time to stand in line at Fuego Grill and it was worth the twenty minutes. Forget calorie counting and grab the el presidente'! BAM!!

data.title: Breakfast Tacos
data.text:
Awesome n would go again! Inexpensive and super popular. Long lines move fairly quickly. Locals seem to love it.
Right near A&M campus. Go earlier on game day. Gig'em Aggies!!!

data.title: Fantastic
data.text: First time here and no idea what to order. We got the Fuego steak and the Dr. Pepper Cowboy and both were great. Fantastic Queso dip. Highly recommend.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Highly overpriced and completely undewhelming. The buffalo bill was disgusting (drowning in sauce), which is a major understatement. Had high hopes from reviews and recommendations, but it definitely fell short. Never going back.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Excellent tacos, burritos, queso, salsa bar and guacamole. My favorite place in College Station - so far.

data.title: Great food for great price
data.text: Fuego has the variety you are looking for at a Tortilla Grill. They are not stingy with pico de gallo and provide excellent fish tacos.

data.title: Tacooooooooooos
data.text: Fuego has been a staple of my time as an Aggie. I'll never forget the first time I brought my parents here ("THIS is a TACO?"). One is probably enough for the average person, they are large, delicious, and filling. You'll wait in a line that wraps around the building after 2am on weekends, and a lonnnnggggg drive through line on weekend mornings (great cure for a hangover). I recommend any of the tacos that include their house-roasted rotisserie chicken.

data.title: Tender, lean steak!
data.text: This place was recommended, and the Fuego Steak taco was pretty good.  My friend enjoyed the Fuego Deluxe taco.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Everything from basic breakfast tacos to extravagant tortilla meals.  Whether its early morning breakfast, afternoon lunch or a stop before going home from north gate, expect a line out the door.  Haven't yet had something I don't like.

data.title: Am I missing something?!
data.text: This place is suppose to have the best tacos ever and so we went on a Sunday morning.  It was crowded so hard to find parking and it took over a half an hour to stand in line and then another 10 minutes to get our food.  I am not a fan of the melted cheese that we ordered with our chips.  I had a breakfast taco and it had the bacon on top in one large piece but it seemed very basic so I didn't see the fuss.  It tasted good but not that amazing.  My son loved the chicken in his taco so I tried it and it seemed much better.  I might try them again for the tacos that aren't the breakfast ones.

data.title: Can't stop dreaming about it!
data.text: This is one of the best Mexican meals I've ever eaten.  I find myself, A year later , thinking about the place.  The food was simply wonderful.  Wish I could open one in Huntsville.

data.title: Best Tacos Around!
data.text: We come here every time we come to A&M to visit our daughter. It can be crowded but it is worth the wait. Tacos are great, eggs made perfect. Tortillas are fresh and hot. Salsas are delicious. Food is served hot. Best carne guisada anywhere, be sure to add cheese to yours. Coffee is really good. All of the staff from cashier to bus staff are courteous and friendly. We love this place and are already looking forward to our next visit.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text:
Went here twice during our 3 night stay in College Station. It gets crowded on a weekend so be prepared for a crowd. It goes pretty quickly though as the waitstaff have their act together. You have to order first before sitting down so it helps with the flow. Or you can order to go either in the drive through or at the shorter line in the restaurant. 
The tacos are pretty huge and priced about right at about $5 a piece. The handmade tortillas are good, the meat selection and toppings are extensive. Grab a menu before you get in line so you'll be ready to order when you get to the cashier. We liked the guacamole and handmade tortilla chips.The chips are light and warm and they give you a whole basket of them with your order. The guacamole is a bit on the salty side (which we liked) but if you don't, then go for the queso dip instead. The college crowd all seemed to order the dip but it looked a bit too cheesy for me. There is a salsa and condiment bar that you can select from and one of those newer drink machines. I tend not to like those machines as much because when you want just a simple plain Coke or Pepsi, it seems like the flavor of another type seeps in your drink as bit. They also had iced tea.
The second time we went, we had the breakfast tacos. These are pretty filled with chorizo and egg, or eggs, potato and meats, and are pretty inexpensive.for the size.
It is a little hard finding the place (when we used our GPS and the construction going on on University Ave) but once you do, it is worth the trip and wait. Enjoy!

data.title: Hit or Miss
data.text: I've received excellent food/service and I've received poor food/service.  Not sure what causes the flux, but when it is good it is good.

data.title: Great food for the price.
data.text: Food is really good. Must try the tortilla soup. Service is very good and fast.  Place is always crowded, but worth wait!

data.title: Texas Size Tacos!
data.text: Fuego is WONDERFUL! If you are visiting or a local this one of the best places for some really good, creative tacos. Oh and the queso might be the best in town. Best to avoid on game day weekends or get there early. They are pretty fast but you can't sit until you order and there is no holding a table. The drive through is normally fast even when it's backed up to the street. Of and they are open 24 hours a day, 6 days a week.

data.title: Any time any day. Except Mondays.
data.text: Great, fresh ingredients. Tesoro de Jordan is awesome. Love the cucumber salad. Breakfast tacos served all day. Be prepared for a line. Popular place because it's so good.
